Description: Title-page with title written on a draped cloth at centre, hung in an arched niche, flanked by Sts Paul and Antony; Sts Elias and John the Baptist seated at top corners, Sts Eugenia and St Paula crouching in lower corners on either side of a small cartouche surmounted by a winged skull in lower centre; after Peter Paul Rubens; title to Heribert Rosweyde's "Vaders Boeck" (Antwerp: 1617). 1617 Engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Jan Collaert III
Curator's comments: For a counterproof of this plate see 1857,0314.15.
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (1948) (The Collaert Dynasty)
Schneevoogt 1873 / Catalogue des estampes gravées d'après P.P.Rubens (204.72)
Corpus Rubenianum XXI / Rubens. Book Illustrations and Title Pages (42)
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Baptist (Prodromos)
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Representation of: St Paul the Hermit
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
